title: 20-year-old man killed in what appears to be accidental shooting in Jackson County
content:
BLACKMAN TOWNSHIP, MI - Police are investigating what appears to be an accidental shooting that occurred Saturday evening.
At 7:25 p.m., officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Big Rock Street in Stonegate Farms on reports that someone at the residence had accidentally shot a family member, Blackman-Leoni Public Safety Sgt. Steve Stowe said.
When they arrived at the scene, Stowe said they found a 20-year-old man dead with a single gunshot wound.
Police would not release further details. The incident is still under investigation.
